section.title: Present perfect
section.sectiontitle: We use have/has + past participle to talk about something that happened ‘some time in my life up to now. We usually use short forms.
section.text1a: I've broken my leg once before.
section.text2a: She's done lots of different jobs.
section.sectiontitle2: We also use the Present perfect to talk about something that happened in a time period which is not finished.
section.text3: It is 3 o'clock in the afternoon. Today isn't finished.
section.text4: It is October. This year isn't finished.

section.title: Present perfect
section.sectiontitle: For regular verbs the past participle is the same as the Past simple. Irregular verbs have irregular past participles.
section.sectiontitle2: In the negative, we use subject + have not/has not + past participle. We usually use short forms.

section.title: Present perfect
section.sectiontitle: In the question, we use have/has + subject + past participle.
section.text1a: Have you seen Mark today? Yes, I have.
section.text2a: Has she bought anything online? No, she hasn't.
